author: eth2_gitter_bot
content:
<jadler> Beam Sync is a sync protocol, like fast sync, i.e. it's a way to populate the initial state trie. Once the sync part is over, going forward the node will be fully validating blocks, which as described above requires an SSD.
TL;DR yes.
Now, full statelessness is another matter, since presumably witnesses are small enough to be kept in RAM (they're on the order of a few megabytes per Ethereum block last I checked, with work on reducing that size). (re @GuthL: Does this answer still hold in the context of Beam Sync of Stateless Eth assuming not full sync in the background? (@tkstanczak))
